Articles.Content: Are you looking for a way to share what your spaceship really looks like? Sketchfab is the leading platform to publish and find the best 3D content anywhere online, and best of all they’ve been working very hard to support KSP’s .craft files. The process of sharing your spaceship is very easy, and is explained in this tutorial video. Our [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/](**FORUM** has supported the Sketchfab bb-code for a while now, so we’re looking forward to see your creations shared in 3D. As an extra incentive we’ll be highlighting the best craft on Sketchfab on our social media, so get to work!
Now this is something I can get excited for!
Is there any way to do this with a Mac? The only exporter I can find is Windows-only, and I hate being left out.
I know the video has the link to the DL stated in it but why not put a clickable link in the main thread??????

> 
> I know the video has the link to the DL stated in it but why not put a clickable link in the main thread??????

Here you go: [https://github.com/sketchfab/ksp-exporter/releases](https://github.com/sketchfab/ksp-exporter/releases)

> 
> Is there any way to do this with a Mac? The only exporter I can find is Windows-only, and I hate being left out.

~~The idea is that Sketchfab now allow you to upload .craft files *directly* without exporting them. So all you need to do is find where on your Mac the files are, and aim the upload dialog at the relevant files.~~

I assume this only applies to STOCK craft!

Nope, I'm wrong.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-05T12:15:30Z" title="06/05/2015 12:15  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 5, 2015</time> by softweir**
  
I'm stupid and I'm wrong.

The command top on the top of the rocket got me intrigued.

Then I saw the MJ thingy.

Doesn't work on OSX. Crap.

- - - Updated - - -

Also, a PSA regarding Sketchfab embeds: They aren't neutralized by quotes like images or albums. So delete any sketchfab embeds in a post you're quoting.

Note- very hard to use. Still looking for the correct EXE in the folder.

Edit- found it. KSP-Exporter/dist/ksp2sketchfab.exe

Note #2- Can NOT reach the upload button on a 1366x768 monitor.

Edit 2- finally got it.

<iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-05T01:01:12Z" title="06/05/2015 01:01  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 5, 2015</time> by kenbobo**
I wonder if you can get the stl file directly to use in a 3d printer at home

> 
> I wonder if you can get the stl file directly to use in a 3d printer at home

From what I read on sketchfab, yes: [https://help.sketchfab.com/hc/en-us/articles/202397889-3D-Printing](https://help.sketchfab.com/hc/en-us/articles/202397889-3D-Printing)

Just keep in mind that little things like struts, etc might be hard to print.
I'm still only seeing 'pre-release' versions listed. Also, it doesn't seem to be finding my craft files.

> 
> Is there any way to do this with a Mac? The only exporter I can find is Windows-only, and I hate being left out.

Looks like the Linux users get ignored too.
no linux version ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I notice that the GitHub KSP exporters were released on April 1st; Happy April Fools' Day! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I suppose that someone who is Code savvy (maybe using Swift?) might be able to create exporters for non-Windows platforms. For those who can use the current exporters, have fun!

> For those who can use the current exporters, have fun!

Had a quick look at the github, seems its written in Python. Might be possible to run this on linux and mac directly from source, will try this weekend

> 
> I'm still only seeing 'pre-release' versions listed. Also, it doesn't seem to be finding my craft files.

You want the beta version. The link is: [https://github.com/sketchfab/ksp-exporter/releases/download/beta/ksp2skfb-win-beta-v1-0.zip](https://github.com/sketchfab/ksp-exporter/releases/download/beta/ksp2skfb-win-beta-v1-0.zip)

> 
> Had a quick look at the github, seems its written in Python. Might be possible to run this on linux and mac directly from source, will try this weekend

I was looking at their Minecraft exporter and it seems that that provides instructions for running it on a Mac, and it is written in Python as well. Requires some command-line fiddling, but it might do. I'll try it out once I'm home from school.
